A homepage or dashboard provides you with a consolidated view of appropriate information and insight into a process based on your role. Gauges and charts displayed on the homepage are typically based on decisions or actions to be taken. With the right information, a homepage or dashboard can help manage work efficiently.

]]>
false incident_dashboard /home.do?sysparm_view=new_incident_overview 3 1 false true

The following are recommendations for incident management homepages:

 
Incident Overview:
The Incident Overview page is designed for incident managers to track overall incident management process.
  • Replace Overdue Incidents with Breached Incidents. This gauge should show the count of open incidents where either the response or resolution SLA has been breached. 
My Incidents:
My Incidents is a homepage designed for incident process users. It provides access to all incidents associated with them or their groups, showing progress, and alerting them to any actions.

Create a new homepage called "My Incident" with the following single count gauges:

 Name Description 
 My Critical Incidents Number of active P1 incidents assigned to me.
 My Open Incidents Number of active incidents assigned to me.
 My Incidents nearing breach Number of active incidents assigned to me where response or resolution SLA has reached 75%  of the allotted time.
 My Groups Incidents not updated for  7  days Number of active incidents assigned to my group that have not been updated in 7 days.
 My Groups Unassigned Incidents Number of active incidents assigned to my group where Assigned to is empty.
 My Groups breached Incidents Number of active incidents assigned to my group where response or resolution SLA has  breached.
 
Create graphs for:
  • My Open Incidents by Age
  • My Groups Open Incidents by Age
  • My Closed Incidents per Week
  • My Groups Closed Incidents per Week

To update or create a new homepage, navigate to Homepage Admin > Pages.

To access the new homepage from the Incident application, create a new module called My Incidents.
